title:
Internet of Things Networks: Enabling Simultaneous Wireless Information
  and Power Transfer
authors:
Prerna Dhull, Andrea P. Guevara, Maral Ansari, Sofie Pollin, Negin
  Shariati, and Dominique Schreurs
abstract:
The number of sensors deployed in the world is expected to explode in the
near future. At this moment, nearly 30 billion Internet of Things (IoT) devices
are connected and this number is expected to double in the next four years.
While not all of these are battery powered, as technology becomes smaller and
mobility becomes more important to consumers, soon a larger portion will be.
This forecast predicts that the number of machine to machine (M2M) devices will
have the largest increase, representing nearly 50% of all devices in 2023.
subjects: Electrical Engineering and Systems Science/Systems and Control
